update.description:
This tutorial is about SVG extrusion. The original tutorial is replaced with a new one that focuses on creating a custom wheel model. It combines elements of the original, and adds specific instruction on how to use Inkscape as well.

The new "combined" now be used as an optional step in the FTU series.

http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=extrude_svg&branch=svg_improvements
update.title: Svg_improvements

content.raw: Good news everyone: the problem is fixed in the latest debs. I verified that the Gnu triangulation gets installed with Gazebo 7 and the extrusion works "out of the box".
content.html: Good news everyone: the problem is fixed in the latest debs. I verified that the Gnu triangulation gets installed with Gazebo 7 and the extrusion works "out of the box".

content.raw: I think the problem was happening even if you had gts, but using debs instead of compiling from source. I think it has been fixed though. The crash has been fixed for sure.
content.html: I think the problem was happening even if you had gts, but using debs instead of compiling from source. I think it has been fixed though. The crash has been fixed for sure.

content.raw:
This was working on my machine, presumably because the gts library was installed.
We need to fix this, but should this problem be stopping the tutorial approval?
content.html: This was working on my machine, presumably because the gts library was installed. We need to fix this, but should this problem be stopping the tutorial approval?

update.description:
This tutorial is about SVG extrusion. The original tutorial is replaced with a new one that focuses on creating a custom wheel model. It combines elements of the original, and adds specific instruction on how to use Inkscape as well.

The new "combined" now be used as an optional step in the FTU series.

http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=extrude_svg&branch=svg_improvements
update.title: Svg_improvements

content.raw:
We've confirmed a QT exception when running Gazebo from debs while importing the svg file:


```
#!python
Qt has caught an exception thrown from an event handler. Throwing
exceptions from an event handler is not supported in Qt. You must
reimplement QApplication::notify() and catch all exceptions there.

terminate called after throwing an instance of 'Ogre::InvalidParametersException'
  what():  OGRE EXCEPTION(2:InvalidParametersException): Object index out of bounds. in SceneNode::getAttachedObject at /build/buildd/ogre-1.8-1.8.1+dfsg/OgreMain/src/OgreSceneNode.cpp (line 160)
```

It seems that gzclient is not linking with `libgts`. @_jrivero_ , could you take a look at the dependencies when generating the deb?
content.html:
We've confirmed a QT exception when running Gazebo from debs while importing the svg file:

Qt has caught an exception thrown from an event handler. Throwing
exceptions from an event handler is not supported in Qt. You must
reimplement QApplication::notify() and catch all exceptions there.

terminate called after throwing an instance of 'Ogre::InvalidParametersException'
  what():  OGRE EXCEPTION(2:InvalidParametersException): Object index out of bounds. in SceneNode::getAttachedObject at /build/buildd/ogre-1.8-1.8.1+dfsg/OgreMain/src/OgreSceneNode.cpp (line 160)

It seems that gzclient is not linking with libgts. @jrivero , could you take a look at the dependencies when generating the deb?

content.raw:
The problem seems to come from before gazebo7:

http://answers.gazebosim.org/question/12235/gts-library-not-found-error/
content.html:
The problem seems to come from before gazebo7:

http://answers.gazebosim.org/question/12235/gts-library-not-found-error/

content.raw: Can you add a step to "File->Save" the svg file in inkscape? The section `Create a Gazebo Model` doesn't describe how to open the SVG import dialog box.
content.html: Can you add a step to "File->Save" the svg file in inkscape? The section Create a Gazebo Model doesn't describe how to open the SVG import dialog box.
